The emergence of science is principally (I know not entirely) a post-Reformation phenomenon, and was contemporaneous with a return to sola scriptura and a more rigorously analytical approach to scriptural texts. I think it's no coincidence that after the pioneering efforts of Galileo and others, the development of what we would recognise as science during the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries took place mainly in the Protestant north.
